alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 10:59AM EDT until further notice by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. .Rainfall totals of around an inch or more in the Mississinewa basin will cause minor flooding on the Mississinewa near Ridgeville. Additional rainfall tonight could extend the amount of time the river stays in flood. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Lowland agricultural flooding along CR 100 W just north of the river. High water affecting a small portion of River Road just east of SR 1 and north of the river. Water is within a few feet vertically of the approaches to SR 1 bridge in western Randolph county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 9.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
